definition: to be successful in every endeavor
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
(negative prefix)/not/no
sharp/favorable/advantage/benefit/profit/interest/to do good to/to benefit
surname Li

sentences.english: He is nearly ever successful on the market, ever-victorious.
sentences.chinese: 他在商場上幾乎無往不利，百戰百勝。

sentences.english: Mandarin speakers can gain an advantage in doing business in China, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，在中國做生意，會講漢語將無往不利。

definition: many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
magnanimous
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to express fully/all one's feelings
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
can't be bought for one thousand in gold (idiom)
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
to move and inspire
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
wealth and profit/riches
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
